service_description:
Resource for people with disabilities who need help starting a Social Security disability application. Non-attorney representatives with a mission to get disability applications approved quickly and avoiding the multi-year appeal process whenever possible. Program referral forms for enrollment screening are found on website.

Bus: 1, 12, 38, 43, 44, 45, 54, 55, 56.
Accepting referrals for Central City Concern case managers and individuals enrolled in specific programs. No walk-ins. Call for more information.

Constructing Hope Pre-Apprenticeship Program offers a no-cost, 10-week, construction education and life skills pre-apprenticeship construction training program for low-income adults and those with legal history. Constructing Hope’s mission is to rebuild lives by encouraging self-sufficiency and providing services for career placement. Constructing Hope also offers a summer program for youth who are 16-19 years old.

listing: COVID Workforce Response Line Mult Co.

service_description:
Jobs for people with barriers to employment, such as a disability, chronic medical issue, in
recovery or criminal record. Temporary staffing division hires for light industrial and administrative
jobs. Security division hires security officers, with DPSST training provided. Call to
set up orientation.

Information and no-cost work incentives planning for individuals receiving SSDI or SSI who are employed or seriously considering re-entering the workforce. For general information about work assistance, call Ticket to Work at 1-800-968-7842. Also, you can fill out an intake form on the website, Call 503-243-2081 or 1-800-452-1694 between 9-11 a.m. or 1-4 p.m., Monday through Friday, or write to Disability Rights Oregon, 511 SW 10th Ave., Suite 200, Portland, OR 97205.

By appointment only. Vocational rehabilitation services, including employment for people with disabilities, ESL and computer classes, job development and job placement; translation and interpretation, resume and interview workshops; ESL support and referral.
Senior Community Services Employment Training Program for low-income and unemployed seniors ages 55 and older. Appointment only. No walk-ins.
Free program that develops personalized job search strategy based on individual strengths and goals. Resume assistance, job leads, job fairs, ESL classes, and interview practice.

Various Locations. Provides hands-on career training for economically disadvantaged youths. GED/high school diploma programs. Free residential training program for youths 16-24 who are low income, homeless, and have a documented disability.  Advanced training opportunities in career choice and/or opportunities to attend college. Call for appt.
Skillgroups, educational and employment resources for Multnomah County only active probation and/or parole cases. All referrals must be made by Probation/Parole Officers

Job readiness workshops for help with resumes, job searches and interviews. Other services
include parenting classes and youth and family programs.

Non-residential, year round school that provides free high school diploma, GED and training  for a Medical Administrative Assistant for women and men ages 16-24. Internship/job placement services, gas stipend or monthly bus pass, daily lunch allowance, bi-weekly attendance stipend, clothing closet on site and drivers education offered.
hours:
Hours: 8 a.m.-4:30 p.m. Mon.-Fri. 
Open house: Wed. 2 p.m.

service_description: Nonprofit organization that advocates for immigrants and day laborers rights. New member orientation every other week. Please call to sign up. Day laborer center for temporary work. Leadership & education programming & advocacy opportunities.
hours:
Hours: 7 a.m.-2 p.m. Mon.-Fri. 
7 a.m.-12 p.m. Sat.

service_description: Online only. Jobs for people with disabilities or other barriers to employment. Apply online. Careers in janitorial, landscape, administrative and product assembly. Call for assistance or go online.
Call for in office appointments. General information about Social Security Disability Insurance and Supplemental Security Income.

Immediate work opportunities through our vendor program. Orientations on Wednesdays and Fridays at 12:30 with requested noon arrival. Due to the pandemic, orientations are limited to five people each week. Please call ahead or visit our office to sign up in advance.
hours: 8:30 - 2:00 p.m; Mon, Weds, Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Please call or sign up in advance.

service_description: Call for an intake appointment.
hours: Hours: 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday thru Friday.

service_description: Vocational rehabilitation, job skills training and job placement for people with disabilities

service_description: Stone Soup is a nonprofit social venture providing training for those facing barriers to employment and housing insecurity. The 12-week job training program provides hands-on culinary skills while feeding residents, businesses, and those on the front lines of food insecurity across the city. To join, fill out an application on our website. Call 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Mon.-Fri. for more information.
